result.execSummary:
The defendant Niles Rodney Payne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Defendant sentenced to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 52 days time served.  

If revoked, Court allows HUBER for work, school and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
*   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*   Pay a fine in the amount of $50.00 inclusive of all mandatory costs and fees, PLUS surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 4, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

*   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
*   Complete Thinking for a Change Program.

*   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
*   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

07-20-2018 Judge Kristy Yang--Court ordered restitution in the amount of $109.39 payable to Rudolph C.. Due by 11-20-2018. Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges and/or fines. Failure to pay will result in civil judgment

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Niles Rodney Payne

records.addlTxt: JOC Amended due to restitution hearing held 07-20-2018

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Nicole A Brandemuehl.  Chelsea Pierski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for restitution hearing.

Court ordered restitution in the amount of $109.39 payable to Rudolph C. due by 11/20/2018. Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Nicole A Brandemuehl.  Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for restitution hearing. Court ordered state to provide the court further documentation regarding restitution amounts.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 20, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Nicole A Brandemuehl in court, defendant Niles Rodney Payne not in court, in custody.  Chelsea Pierski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for restitution hearing. Defense counsel requests more time to review restitution information. Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 47.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 29, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Nicole A Brandemuehl, as a friend of the Court.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Restitution hearing. Attorney Brandemuehl appeared by phone. State advised the Court that they have complied with Victim Notification; however, restitution documents have not been filed with the Court. Court ordered case adjourned for Restitution hearing in Branch 47. Attorney Brandemuehl to contact the Public Defender's Office to be re-appointed to this case.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 13, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Nicole A Brandemuehl.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 52 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS. If revoked, Court allows HUBER for work, school and treatment.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Complete Thinking for a Change Program.
     *   Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
     *   Pay a fine in the amount of $50.00 inclusive of all mandatory costs and fees,
          PLUS surcharges (including DNA surcharge) by the end of probation.
          Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment.

  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 4, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
All previously ordered conditions of bond remain the same.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Nicole A Brandemuehl.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court orders defendant turned over to Justice Point for supervision with GPS monitoring. All previously ordered conditions remain the same. Court orders no contact with victims or State will revoke offer. Court adjourns case for Sentencing in Br 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Victime Impact Statement and Restitution Worksheet, received and filed.
Court is down on 3/26/2018. Case rescheduled to 4/3/2018 at 1:30 p.m. Parties notified.

Attorney William Hotchkiss for attorney Nicole A Brandemuehl in court, defendant Niles Rodney Payne not in court, in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense counsel requests more time to review.  Status conference scheduled for March 26, 2018 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Rudolph C.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yang, Branch 47.  Defendant not eligible for public defendant representation if released.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 1, 2018 at 08:30 am.
no reply from defendant or surety.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) gj
JusticePoint Discharge Summary, received and filed.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne not in court.  Kristyn R Kuzniar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in custody.  Kristyn R Kuzniar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Angel Johnson in court, defendant Niles Rodney Payne not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Court suspended the proceedings to the return on doctor's report hearing in Branch 47.  Court ordered defendant remained remanded.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 29, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Vioaltion report of new criminal charges, received and filed

17RM040224  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/01/17. er
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Mark P. Dooley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Bryanndi Flagg-Oglen.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.   Case remains calendared for Scheduling Conference on June 14, 2017 at 8:30 am in Branch 47.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No possession of dangerous weapons, firearms, or bb guns. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Justice point discharge summary report received and filed. lr
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justice point report received and filed.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney T. Dick for  Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Positive drug test received.  Court admonished the defendant but did not change the bail.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant to be TAD evaluated.    DPA Hearing adjourned to Branch 47.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Niles Rodney Payne in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
